name: HD 75784
scenarioDescription:
The HD 75784 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 75784 is a star with 1.26 times the mass of the Sun, and 3.4 times its radius. It is located 279.32 light years away from the solar system.

HD 75784 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 75784 system


HD 75784 b

HD 75784 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 75784 b is 318 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 75784 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 75784 c

HD 75784 c was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 8.40 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 75784 c is 1793.52 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 75784 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 75784, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by W. M. Keck Observatory.
